Experiment Method.Assay Method: Confocal Imaging and Mitochondrial Function Assay

Material used.Description: Confocal imaging was performed on PINK1 knockout neurons to assess mitochondrial membrane potential (ΔΨ m), morphology, and reactive oxygen species (ROS) levels.

Readout description.Result Description: G309D failed to rescue mitochondrial membrane potential depolarization and increased ROS production compared to wild-type PINK1.
E417G failed to rescue mitochondrial fragmentation and ROS levels, similar to PINK1 knockout controls.
CΔ145 caused severe mitochondrial dysfunction, including depolarized ΔΨ m and excessive ROS production.

Biological replicates.Description: Not explicitly mentioned in the literature.

Technical replicates.Description: Not explicitly mentioned in the literature.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type PINK1 overexpression rescued mitochondrial dysfunction and reduced ROS levels.

Basic negative control.Description: PINK1 knockout neurons served as the negative control, exhibiting depolarized ΔΨ m and fragmented mitochondria.

Statistical analysis method.Description: Not explicitly mentioned in the literature.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Mitochondrial membrane potential (ΔΨ m) maintained at baseline levels; ROS levels below baseline thresholds.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: ΔΨ m depolarization > 50% baseline; ROS levels > 2-fold baseline.
